column4: i still need help on compiling and installing a program under ubunutu
I'm sure here is someone who can help me
imagemagick
i downloaded the source, extracted it, ./configure, make, make install
but convert -version still brings the old one
what step did I miss?
yep, the steps i listed above
why don't you install the official version from repo?
what have the official imagemagick web version, that the the repo version doesn't have?
but there are some new features? the "old" version does not work?
perhaps you should look for the options available on the ./configure step
for example, i use to use ffmpeg compiled from svn sources
perhaps in the help files there are not any options listed
but i have just searched the imagemagick web, and look at the following link http://www.imagemagick.org/script/advanced-unix-installation.php
there are many options available
yes, but as ffmpeg, by default, there are some featured disabled by default
you if you want to have them, you have to recompile with the correct options enabled
did you find something in the link y pasted before?
looks like it's the 64bit version, that's what I found in the configure options...
you could try to install the precompiled binary offered in the imagemagick web
ok I'll do so

i agree with MichaelDobrovits unistall first the previous release of imagemagick you have installed, purge all its components, and then try to reinstall it from sources, if it fails again, then try (first unistall again) to install the binary package ofered in their web but they are rpm files, you can convert them to deb using the program alien, to see how aliens works, type man alien, but you have to install it first, of course
